Browse the source code of netbsd/external/mpl/bind/dist/lib/isc/include/isc/sockaddr.h

1/* $NetBSD: sockaddr.h,v 1.3 2019/01/09 16:55:15 christos Exp $ */

14
15#ifndef ISC_SOCKADDR_H
16#define ISC_SOCKADDR_H 1
17
18/*! \file isc/sockaddr.h */
19
20#include <stdbool.h>
21
22#include <isc/lang.h>
23#include <isc/net.h>
24#include <isc/types.h>
25#ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_HAVESYSUNH
26#include <sys/un.h>
27#endif
28
29struct isc_sockaddr {
30 union {
31 struct sockaddr sa;
32 struct sockaddr_in sin;
33 struct sockaddr_in6 sin6;
34 struct sockaddr_storage ss;
35#ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_HAVESYSUNH
36 struct sockaddr_un sunix;
37#endif
38 } type;
39 unsigned int length; /* XXXRTH beginning? */
40 ISC_LINK(struct isc_sockaddr) link;
41};
42
43#define ISC_SOCKADDR_CMPADDR 0x0001 /*%< compare the address
44 * sin_addr/sin6_addr */
45#define ISC_SOCKADDR_CMPPORT 0x0002 /*%< compare the port
46 * sin_port/sin6_port */
47#define ISC_SOCKADDR_CMPSCOPE 0x0004 /*%< compare the scope
48 * sin6_scope */
49#define ISC_SOCKADDR_CMPSCOPEZERO 0x0008 /*%< when comparing scopes
50 * zero scopes always match */
51
52ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
53
54bool
55isc_sockaddr_compare(const isc_sockaddr_t *a, const isc_sockaddr_t *b,
56 unsigned int flags);
57/*%<
58 * Compare the elements of the two address ('a' and 'b') as specified
59 * by 'flags' and report if they are equal or not.
60 *
61 * 'flags' is set from ISC_SOCKADDR_CMP*.
62 */
63
64bool
65isc_sockaddr_equal(const isc_sockaddr_t *a, const isc_sockaddr_t *b);
66/*%<
67 * Return true iff the socket addresses 'a' and 'b' are equal.
68 */
69
70bool
71isc_sockaddr_eqaddr(const isc_sockaddr_t *a, const isc_sockaddr_t *b);
72/*%<
73 * Return true iff the address parts of the socket addresses
74 * 'a' and 'b' are equal, ignoring the ports.
75 */
76
77bool
78isc_sockaddr_eqaddrprefix(const isc_sockaddr_t *a, const isc_sockaddr_t *b,
79 unsigned int prefixlen);
80/*%<
81 * Return true iff the most significant 'prefixlen' bits of the
82 * socket addresses 'a' and 'b' are equal, ignoring the ports.
83 * If 'b''s scope is zero then 'a''s scope will be ignored.
84 */
85
86unsigned int
87isc_sockaddr_hash(const isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, bool address_only);
88/*%<
89 * Return a hash value for the socket address 'sockaddr'. If 'address_only'
90 * is true, the hash value will not depend on the port.
91 *
92 * IPv6 addresses containing mapped IPv4 addresses generate the same hash
93 * value as the equivalent IPv4 address.
94 */
95
96void
97isc_sockaddr_any(isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr);
98/*%<
99 * Return the IPv4 wildcard address.
100 */
101
102void
103isc_sockaddr_any6(isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr);
104/*%<
105 * Return the IPv6 wildcard address.
106 */
107
108void
109isc_sockaddr_anyofpf(isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, int family);
110/*%<
111 * Set '*sockaddr' to the wildcard address of protocol family
112 * 'family'.
113 *
114 * Requires:
115 * \li 'family' is AF_INET or AF_INET6.
116 */
117
118void
119isc_sockaddr_fromin(isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, const struct in_addr *ina,
120 in_port_t port);
121/*%<
122 * Construct an isc_sockaddr_t from an IPv4 address and port.
123 */
124
125void
126isc_sockaddr_fromin6(isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, const struct in6_addr *ina6,
127 in_port_t port);
128/*%<
129 * Construct an isc_sockaddr_t from an IPv6 address and port.
130 */
131
132void
133isc_sockaddr_v6fromin(isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, const struct in_addr *ina,
134 in_port_t port);
135/*%<
136 * Construct an IPv6 isc_sockaddr_t representing a mapped IPv4 address.
137 */
138
139void
140isc_sockaddr_fromnetaddr(isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, const isc_netaddr_t *na,
141 in_port_t port);
142/*%<
143 * Construct an isc_sockaddr_t from an isc_netaddr_t and port.
144 */
145
146int
147isc_sockaddr_pf(const isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr);
148/*%<
149 * Get the protocol family of 'sockaddr'.
150 *
151 * Requires:
152 *
153 *\li 'sockaddr' is a valid sockaddr with an address family of AF_INET
154 * or AF_INET6.
155 *
156 * Returns:
157 *
158 *\li The protocol family of 'sockaddr', e.g. PF_INET or PF_INET6.
159 */
160
161void
162isc_sockaddr_setport(isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, in_port_t port);
163/*%<
164 * Set the port of 'sockaddr' to 'port'.
165 */
166
167in_port_t
168isc_sockaddr_getport(const isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr);
169/*%<
170 * Get the port stored in 'sockaddr'.
171 */
172
173isc_result_t
174isc_sockaddr_totext(const isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, isc_buffer_t *target);
175/*%<
176 * Append a text representation of 'sockaddr' to the buffer 'target'.
177 * The text will include both the IP address (v4 or v6) and the port.
178 * The text is null terminated, but the terminating null is not
179 * part of the buffer's used region.
180 *
181 * Returns:
182 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
183 * \li ISC_R_NOSPACE The text or the null termination did not fit.
184 */
185
186void
187isc_sockaddr_format(const isc_sockaddr_t *sa, char *array, unsigned int size);
188/*%<
189 * Format a human-readable representation of the socket address '*sa'
190 * into the character array 'array', which is of size 'size'.
191 * The resulting string is guaranteed to be null-terminated.
192 */
193
194bool
195isc_sockaddr_ismulticast(const isc_sockaddr_t *sa);
196/*%<
197 * Returns #true if the address is a multicast address.
198 */
199
200bool
201isc_sockaddr_isexperimental(const isc_sockaddr_t *sa);
202/*
203 * Returns true if the address is a experimental (CLASS E) address.
204 */
205
206bool
207isc_sockaddr_islinklocal(const isc_sockaddr_t *sa);
208/*%<
209 * Returns true if the address is a link local address.
210 */
211
212bool
213isc_sockaddr_issitelocal(const isc_sockaddr_t *sa);
214/*%<
215 * Returns true if the address is a sitelocal address.
216 */
217
218bool
219isc_sockaddr_isnetzero(const isc_sockaddr_t *sa);
220/*%<
221 * Returns true if the address is in net zero.
222 */
223
224isc_result_t
225isc_sockaddr_frompath(isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, const char *path);
226/*
227 * Create a UNIX domain sockaddr that refers to path.
228 *
229 * Returns:
230 * \li ISC_R_NOSPACE
231 * \li ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED
232 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
233 */
234
235#define ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE \
236 sizeof("xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX%SSSSSSSSSS#YYYYY")
237/*%<
238 * Minimum size of array to pass to isc_sockaddr_format().
239 */
240
241ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
242
243#endif /* ISC_SOCKADDR_H */
244
